*[[Visual kei]] **[[Nagoya kei]] *[[Worldbeat]] }} ==Exclusions== Genres or styles that are not contemporary or commercially marketed in substantial numbers have been excluded, as follows: *Music written for the score of a [[Play (theatre)|play]], [[Musical theatre|musicals]], or similar: [[Filmi]], [[incidental music]], [[video game music]], [[music hall]] songs and [[Show tune|showtunes]] *[[Ballroom dance]] music: [[Tango music|tango]], [[pasodoble]], [[cha-cha-cha (music)|cha cha cha]] and others *[[Religious music]]: [[Gregorian chant]], [[Spiritual (music)|spirituals]], [[hymn]]s and the like *Occasional music: [[Military band|Military music]], [[March (music)|marches]], [[national anthem]]s and related compositions *Regional and national music with no significant commercial impact abroad, except when it is a version of an international genre, such as: [[traditional music]], [[oral tradition]]s, [[Sea shanty|sea shanties]], [[work song]]s, [[nursery rhyme]]s, [[Arabesque music|Arabesque]] and [[indigenous music]] ==References== {{portal|Lists}} {{Reflist}} ==Bibliography== *Borthwick, Stuart, & Moy, Ron (2004) ''Popular Music Genres: An Introduction''.
